ai-anya-e0105n14:1_0: A royal palace named Goṭamukha, having constructed the five great Ārāmas Relics of the Mahāthūpa, the Aṅguttara, demolished five hundred Bhikkhus,. Having charming the Doctrines in the Mahāthūpa, the Aṅgas Cetiya Vihāras, the Sanctuary five hundred Bhikkhus, the chief of men, the Jeṭṭhas, having converted the Doctor of Buddhas. Having rivers, he questioned the Jeṭṭhas, –
ai-anya-e0105n14:2_0: Then, after going to the Ajitas’ monastery amongst the monks, some monks went to that charnel ground,
ai-anya-e0105n14:2_1: But when he saw some of them he taught the going forth, and when he saw them message, he thought,
ai-anya-e0105n14:2_2: He, having considered a poisonous viper, because of the Lord of the World, having caused the great king to (supernatural) vision, he thought, “I will go to that place, having gained faith in the Mahāmeghavana garden,” and after going to his son, he said to them, “I will take care of the Relics,” he pronounced his son,
ai-anya-e0105n14:2_3: Likewise the sake of his own hands, he shook the sword to his own hands, gave it to his own archery, trading his own affairs, and only to train him by striking him with a great deal of wealth.
ai-anya-e0105n14:2_4: After the death of Jeṭṭhatissa his younger brother, known by the name of Divinities, constructed for his arrow. When he had eaten, he continually presented to the king’s horns, undertook the palace of elephants, horses, or chariots, and infantry, he is drawing the golden staircase.
ai-anya-e0105n14:3_0: But the Great Wisdom, Kāḷī, and also Migāra’s mother, caught (afterwards). Having plunged into the Great Wood, under the hall with the ordrawn mass of various kinds,
ai-anya-e0105n14:3_1: And because they were unable to persuade that king and gave him permission to the king, they gave him another part of the following day, saying: “A large mendicant would not eat whatever food he likes to eat the food, the king’s act.”
ai-anya-e0105n14:3_2: Then the great crowds having wandered for alms in the Great Monastery and the three watches of the night, thinking: “We will go to the precincts,” and during the day, “Let us not all three people, prepare the palace, but all these three people will die in the Great Wood, and because we will be able to live there.” And all these people, he accept it will be his supporters of the lay life.’
